TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UserTagSetDefinition extends Microsoft.Health.AuthorizationSetDefinition

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This class will soon be removed from the SDK. Please use HealthRecordItem.Flags to restrict item access or HealthRecordItem.Tags to use user tags.")

Docs.summary: Defines a set of health record items for authorization purposes whose user tags are within a specified set.
Docs.remarks: Permissions on data in a person's health records are always included in an authorization set (whether implicitly via their type or effective date, or explicitly by setting the system set.) This class serves as a set of health record items that have effective dates falling within the specified range. Other types of authorization sets include: . .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string userTags) cil managed

Docs.param: A string with comma-separated user tags.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified user tags.
Docs.exception: The parameter is null or does not contain at least one valid user tag.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetXml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the XML representation of the set.
Docs.returns: The XML representation of the set as a string.
Docs.remarks: The XML representation adheres to the schema required by the HealthVault methods.
Docs.exception: If no user tags are specified in the property.
